data.title: BALFOUR BEATTY ENGINEERING SERVICES BLACKFRIARS STATION HV CABLING :: Butler and Young Associates
data.text:
Back to Project Showcase page

Project

Blackfriars HV Cabling Diversions (Blackfriars Station Reconstruction)

Client

Balfour Beatty Engineering Services Limited, Power Systems, Unit 5, Greenwich Centre Business Park, 53 Norman Road, Greenwich, London SE10 9QF

Project Details

As part of the major station reconstruction of Blackfriars Station a new transformer room was constructed adjacent the westbound LUL District Line platform. In order to provide the required HV cable connections to the transformer room cable diversions were required to HV cables F600 & F630 and Pilot cables P413 & P414.? HV cables F600 & F630 and pilot cable P414 originally ran along the tunnel wall adjacent to the eastbound running line and entered the eastbound platform invert. These cables were diverted over to the tunnel wall adjacent to the westbound running line to enter the westbound platform invert.

Project Deliverables

Site surveys

Production of cable route designs and photo sketches

Production of detailed drawings for bespoke cable hangers and brackets.

Structural detailed designs and structural assessments

Track clearance measurements

Production of detailed track clearance drawings

Production and supply of design check certificate(s)

Production and supply cutting drilling and fixing logs

Production and supply design risk assessments

Specifications for civil/structural works

Attendance at design reviews

Intrusive surveys

Preparation of concessions

Preparation of Conceptual Design Statements (CDS)

Preparation of Compliance Submissions

Location

District Line running tunnels adjacent Blackfriars Underground Station, and station platforms.
